ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English un- + able. Formed by prefixing un- ('not') to the adjective able, which derives from Old French hable, ultimately from Latin habilis ('apt, fit').

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Lacking the necessary power, capability, skill, or opportunity to perform an action; not able.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 缺乏必要的能力、技能或机会去执行某事；不能。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I was unable to attend the meeting because of a prior commitment.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 由于事先的承诺，我无法出席那次会议。
